plants.name: Aster amellus
plants.description: A hardy perennial wildflower and garden plant native to Europe, known for its daisy-like violet-blue flowers. It thrives in temperate climates and is a common sight in meadows and gardens.
plants.funFact: Michaelmas Daisies often signal the approach of Michaelmas (September 29), traditionally marking the start of autumn in Europe.

plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A bright and cheerful wildflower native to North America, with golden yellow petals surrounding a dark brown central cone. It is widely cultivated in gardens and is drought-tolerant.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans attract pollinators like bees and butterflies and often bloom late into the growing season, including September.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub with large, vibrant flowers typically red, pink, or orange. Commonly cultivated in subtropical and tropical regions, blooming year-round with peak flowering in warm months.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropics, peak late summer to fall
plants.funFact: Each hibiscus flower lasts only a day, but the plant produces many blooms throughout the warm seasons.

plants.name: Callicarpa americana
plants.description: A native shrub to the southeastern United States known for its striking clusters of bright purple berries in fall, following delicate lavender-pink flowers in late summer.
plants.bloomingSeason: August to September (flowers), berries appear in fall
